frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Clark M. Wheeler, Jr. Diary, 1873-1873 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.332
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Diary of Clark M. Wheeler, Jr. of Cambridgeport, Massachusetts for the year 1873. In brief daily entries, Clark Wheeler recorded weather, work routines, chores, home life and social activities, like going to clubs. Also includes monthly cash accounts and lists two of his employers in Boston. Wheeler seems to have worked as a shop assistant in Boston, while living with his parents in Cambridgeport. Toward the end of the year he was discharged and started working for Whitten, Burdett and Young, a wholesale manufacturer of clothing.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Clark M. Wheeler, Jr. Diary, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 07/27/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and processed in July 2009 by Ute Schechter.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Clark M. Wheeler, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary of Clark M. Wheeler, Jr. of Cambridgeport, Massachusetts for the year 1873. In brief daily entries, Clark Wheeler recorded weather, work routines, chores, home life and social activities, like going to clubs. Also includes monthly cash accounts and lists two of his employers in Boston. Wheeler seems to have worked as a shop assistant in Boston, while living with his parents in Cambridgeport. Toward the end of the year he was discharged and started working for Whitten, Burdett and Young, a wholesale manufacturer of clothing.
